a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Indoor air pollution vs. outdoor air pollution death rate, 2021
The age-standardized death rates from household air pollution (caused by cooking and heating with solid fuels)
versus outdoor particulate matter air pollution, measured as the number of deaths per 100,000 individuals.
Countries above the comparison line have higher death rates from indoor air pollution than outdoor.
Death rate from outdoor air pollution (deaths per 100,000 people)
Death rate from indoor air pollution (deaths per 100,000 people)
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024)
